item.title: Dazzle Duck Blog
item.description: Latest updates, tutorials, and engineering deep dives from the Dazzle Duck SQL Server team.

item.title: Dazzle Duck Community Roadmap — 2025
item.description: We’re thrilled to share the 2025 roadmap for Dazzle Duck!
item.content:encoded:
We’re thrilled to share the 2025 roadmap for Dazzle Duck!
Expect better analytics, more integrations, and an expanding open-source community.

item.title: Extending Dazzle Duck with Custom Functions
item.description: Dazzle Duck was designed to be modular and hackable.
item.content:encoded:
Dazzle Duck was designed to be modular and hackable.
In this article, we’ll walk through writing your own extension to add custom SQL functions.

item.title: Inside Dazzle Duck: Architecture Overview
item.description: In this post, we’ll dive deep into Dazzle Duck’s internal architecture —
item.content:encoded:
In this post, we’ll dive deep into Dazzle Duck’s internal architecture —
how the parser, optimizer, and execution engine come together for blazing-fast queries.

We’ll cover:

  • The query planner
  • Vectorized execution
  • Plugin system for extensions

item.title: Introducing Dazzle Duck — A Smarter SQL Engine
item.description: Welcome to the very first post of Dazzle Duck —
item.content:encoded:
Welcome to the very first post of Dazzle Duck —
an open-source analytical SQL server built for performance, extensibility, and fun.

In this post, we’ll explore what Dazzle Duck is, why it matters, and how you can start contributing.

Learn more in our Docs.
